item.title: Unblock Your AI (For Good)
item.description:
Many teams I’ve worked with start out making rapid progress with their AI - usually a RAG system. At first, iteration is fast. Each tweak makes a visible difference. But then, they hit a plateau.

Changes don’t seem to make a clear impact anymore. Some changes even backfire. The AI isn’t broken, but it’s no longer clear what to fix—or even how to tell if it’s improving at all.

When Metrics Stop Making Sense

That’s when most teams turn to metrics. And that’s where things usually go wrong.

item.title: How to Fail your AI Project – Like I Did
item.description:
A few years ago, I worked on my first Generative AI project: a customer-facing AI assistant. The company had unique customer data and believed AI could transform it into a highly personalized, valuable chatbot.

We built a prototype fast. Our users were excited about the first demo.

Our First Big Mistake

But there was a catch: we had almost no access to real users. With so few user tests, we had to rely on ourselves—we became our own test users.
